content.content:
`.applications`

Use the **applications** resource to create, read, update and delete apps in
a merchant's store, you can edit all application properties and also work with all
application subresources directly at this resource

meta.description: The working state of this app in the shop
App unique slug, only lowercase letters, numbers and hyphen - Min length: **3** - Max length: **50** - RegEx pattern: **`^[0-9a-z-]+$`**
Version of the application that was installed, eg.: 1.0.0 - Min length: **5** - Max length: **8** - RegEx pattern: **`^(0|([1-9][0-9]?))[.](0|([1-9][0-9]?))[.](0|([1-9][0-9]?))$`**
When app installation was updated, date and time in ISO 8601 standard representation - Format: **date-time**
If this app is a package of a module, specify the module
If this app is a dashboard or storefront JS, specify resources that trigger the script load - Max elements: **100**
Link to GitHub repository - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
Status defined by seller, such as active or waiting - Max length: **50**
Whether this app needs to authenticate with API
Endpoint that receives POST back with authentication credentials, must be https - Max length: **255** - Format: **uri**
If this app uses authentication, list the needed permissions - Min properties: **1** - Max properties: **20**
Flags to associate additional info - Max elements: **10**
Optional notes with additional info about this user - Max length: **255**

content.content:
*/applications.json?limit&offset&sort&fields\&[field]* > Authentication
_GET_: **required** Use [default URL parameters](#introduction/overview/url-params) (metadata) for pagination and ordering, you can use any other parameter to query by particular object properties

meta.description: Max number of objects to return
meta.title: number

content.content:
*/applications.json* > Authentication
_POST_: **required** Request body must obey the specifications of [this model](#reference/applications/application-object)

*/applications/[_id].json* > Authentication
_GET_: **optional**
_PATCH_, _PUT_, _DELETE_: **required** In read requests, response body will follow [this model](#reference/applications/application-object), requests without authentication will receive application data without `authentication`, `auth_scope` and `hidden_data` properties For overwriting and editing, request body must obey the same specifications, but especially for edit requests there are no required fields
